01493 
01494 /**
01495  * cvmx_dfm_fnt_ctl
01496  *
01497  * Specify the RSL base addresses for the block
01498  *
01499  *                  DFM_FNT_CTL = DFM Front Control Register
01500  *
01501  * This register contains control registers for the DFM Front Section of Logic.
01502  */
01503 union cvmx_dfm_fnt_ctl {
01504     uint64_t u64;
01505     struct cvmx_dfm_fnt_ctl_s {
01506 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01507     uint64_t reserved_4_63                : 60;
01508     uint64_t sbe_ena                      : 1;  /**< If SBE_ENA=1 & RECC_ENA=1 then all single bit errors
01509                                                          which have been detected/corrected during GWALK reads,
01510                                                          will be reported through RWORD0[REA]=ERR code in system
01511                                                          memory at the conclusion of the DFA instruction.
01512                                                          SWNOTE: The application user may wish to report single
01513                                                          bit errors that were corrected through the
01514                                                          RWORD0[REA]=ERR codeword.
01515                                                          NOTE: This DOES NOT effect the reporting of SBEs in
01516                                                          DFM_FNT_STAT[SBE] (which were corrected if RECC_ENA=1).
01517                                                          This bit is only here for applications which 'MAY' want
01518                                                          to be alerted with an ERR completion code if there were
01519                                                          SBEs that were auto-corrected during GWALK instructions.
01520                                                          Recap: If there is a SBE and SBE_ENA==1, the "err" field
01521                                                          in the data returned to DFA will be set.  If SBE_ENA==0,
01522                                                          the "err" is always 0 when there is a SBE; however,
01523                                                          regardless of SBE_ENA, DBE will cause "err" to be 1. */
01524     uint64_t wecc_ena                     : 1;  /**< If WECC_ENA=1, HW will auto-generate(overwrite) the 10b
01525                                                          OWECC codeword during Memory Writes sourced by
01526                                                          1) DFA MLOAD instructions, or by 2) NCB-Direct CSR
01527                                                          mode writes to DFA memory space. The HW will insert
01528                                                          the 10b OWECC inband into OW-DATA[127:118].
01529                                                          If WECC_ENA=0, SW is responsible for generating the
01530                                                          10b OWECC codeword inband in the upper OW-data[127:118]
01531                                                          during Memory writes (to provide SEC/DED coverage for
01532                                                          the data during subsequent Memory reads-see RECC_ENA). */
01533     uint64_t recc_ena                     : 1;  /**< If RECC_ENA=1, all DFA memory reads sourced by 1) DFA
01534                                                          GWALK instructions or by 2) NCB-Direct CSR mode reads
01535                                                          to DFA memory space, will be protected by an inband 10b
01536                                                          OWECC SEC/DED codeword. The inband OW-DATA[127:118]
01537                                                          represents the inband OWECC codeword which offers single
01538                                                          bit error correction(SEC)/double bit error detection(DED).
01539                                                          [see also DFM_FNT_STAT[SBE,DBE,FADR,FSYN] status fields].
01540                                                          The FSYN field contains an encoded value which determines
01541                                                          which bit was corrected(for SBE) or detected(for DBE) to
01542                                                          help in bit isolation of the error.
01543                                                          SW NOTE: If RECC_ENA=1: An NCB-Direct CSR mode read of the
01544                                                          upper QW in memory will return ZEROES in the upper 10b of the
01545                                                          data word.
01546                                                          If RECC_ENA=0: An NCB-Direct CSR mode read of the upper QW in
01547                                                          memory will return the RAW 64bits from memory. During memory
01548                                                          debug, writing RECC_ENA=0 provides visibility into the raw ECC
01549                                                          stored in memory at that time. */
01550     uint64_t dfr_ena                      : 1;  /**< DFM Memory Interface Enable
01551                                                          The DFM powers up with the DDR3 interface disabled.
01552                                                          If the DFA function is required, then after poweron
01553                                                          software configures a stable DFM DDR3 memory clock
01554                                                          (see: LMCx_DDR_PLL_CTL[DFM_PS_EN, DFM_DIV_RESET]),
01555                                                          the DFM DDR3 memory interface can be enabled.
01556                                                          When disabled (DFR_ENA=0), all DFM DDR3 memory
01557                                                          output and bidirectional pins will be tristated.
01558                                                          SW NOTE: The DFR_ENA=1 write MUST occur sometime after
01559                                                          the DFM is brought out of reset (ie: after the
01560                                                          DFM_DLL_CTL2[DRESET]=0 write). */
01561 #else
01562     uint64_t dfr_ena                      : 1;
01563     uint64_t recc_ena                     : 1;
01564     uint64_t wecc_ena                     : 1;
01565     uint64_t sbe_ena                      : 1;
01566     uint64_t reserved_4_63                : 60;
01567 #endif
01568     } s;
01569     struct cvmx_dfm_fnt_ctl_s             cn63xx;
01570     struct cvmx_dfm_fnt_ctl_s             cn63xxp1;
01571     struct cvmx_dfm_fnt_ctl_s             cn66xx;
01572 };
01573 typedef union cvmx_dfm_fnt_ctl cvmx_dfm_fnt_ctl_t;
01574 
01575 /**

01592                                                          When set, the memory controller raises a processor
01593                                                          interrupt on detecting a correctable single bit
01594                                                          OWECC error which was corrected during a memory
01595                                                          read. */

01608 /**
01609  * cvmx_dfm_fnt_sclk
01610  *
01611  * DFM_FNT_SCLK = DFM Front SCLK Control Register
01612  *
01613  * This register contains control registers for the DFM Front Section of Logic.
01614  * NOTE: This register is in USCLK domain and is ised to enable the conditional SCLK grid, as well as
01615  * to start a software BiST sequence for the DFM sub-block. (note: the DFM has conditional clocks which
01616  * prevent BiST to run under reset automatically).
01617  */
01618 union cvmx_dfm_fnt_sclk {
01619     uint64_t u64;
01620     struct cvmx_dfm_fnt_sclk_s {
01621 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01622     uint64_t reserved_3_63                : 61;
01623     uint64_t clear_bist                   : 1;  /**< When START_BIST is written 0->1, if CLEAR_BIST=1, all
01624                                                          previous BiST state is cleared.
01625                                                          NOTES:
01626                                                          1) CLEAR_BIST must be written to 1 before START_BIST
01627                                                          is written to 1 using a separate CSR write.
01628                                                          2) CLEAR_BIST must not be changed after writing START_BIST
01629                                                          0->1 until the BIST operation completes. */
01630     uint64_t bist_start                   : 1;  /**< When software writes BIST_START=0->1, a BiST is executed
01631                                                          for the DFM sub-block.
01632                                                          NOTES:
01633                                                          1) This bit should only be written after BOTH sclk
01634                                                          and fclk have been enabled by software and are stable
01635                                                          (see: DFM_FNT_SCLK[SCLKDIS] and instructions on how to
01636                                                          enable the DFM DDR3 memory (fclk) - which requires LMC
01637                                                          PLL init, DFM clock divider and proper DFM DLL
01638                                                          initialization sequence). */
01639     uint64_t sclkdis                      : 1;  /**< DFM sclk disable Source
01640                                                          When SET, the DFM sclk are disabled (to conserve overall
01641                                                          chip clocking power when the DFM function is not used).
01642                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
01643                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
01644 #else
01645     uint64_t sclkdis                      : 1;
01646     uint64_t bist_start                   : 1;
01647     uint64_t clear_bist                   : 1;
01648     uint64_t reserved_3_63                : 61;
01649 #endif
01650     } s;
01651     struct cvmx_dfm_fnt_sclk_s            cn63xx;
01652     struct cvmx_dfm_fnt_sclk_s            cn63xxp1;
01653     struct cvmx_dfm_fnt_sclk_s            cn66xx;
01654 };
01655 typedef union cvmx_dfm_fnt_sclk cvmx_dfm_fnt_sclk_t;
01656 
01657 /**
01658  * cvmx_dfm_fnt_stat
01659  *
01660  * DFM_FNT_STAT = DFM Front Status Register
01661  *
01662  * This register contains error status information for the DFM Front Section of Logic.
01663  */
01664 union cvmx_dfm_fnt_stat {
01665     uint64_t u64;
01666     struct cvmx_dfm_fnt_stat_s {
01667 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01668     uint64_t reserved_42_63               : 22;
01669     uint64_t fsyn                         : 10; /**< Failing Syndrome
01670                                                          If SBE_ERR=1, the FSYN code determines which bit was
01671                                                          corrected during the OWECC check/correct.
01672                                                          NOTE: If both DBE_ERR/SBE_ERR are set, the DBE_ERR has
01673                                                          higher priority and FSYN captured will always be for the
01674                                                          DBE_ERR detected.
01675                                                          The FSYN is "locked down" when either DBE_ERR/SBE_ERR
01676                                                          are detected (until these bits are cleared (W1C)).
01677                                                          However, if an SBE_ERR occurs first, followed by a
01678                                                          DBE_ERR, the higher priority DBE_ERR will re-capture
01679                                                          the FSYN for the higher priority error case. */
01680     uint64_t fadr                         : 28; /**< Failing Memory octaword address
01681                                                          If either SBE_ERR or DBE_ERR are set, the FADR
01682                                                          represents the failing octaword address.
01683                                                          NOTE: If both DBE_ERR/SBE_ERR are set, the DBE_ERR has
01684                                                          higher priority and the FADR captured will always be
01685                                                          with the DBE_ERR detected.
01686                                                          The FADR is "locked down" when either DBE_ERR/SBE_ERR
01687                                                          are detected (until these bits are cleared (W1C)).
01688                                                          However, if an SBE_ERR occurs first, followed by a
01689                                                          DBE_ERR, the higher priority DBE_ERR will re-capture
01690                                                          the FADR for the higher priority error case. */
01691     uint64_t reserved_2_3                 : 2;
01692     uint64_t dbe_err                      : 1;  /**< Double bit error detected(uncorrectable) during
01693                                                          Memory Read.
01694                                                          Write of 1 will clear the corresponding error bit */
01695     uint64_t sbe_err                      : 1;  /**< Single bit error detected(corrected) during
01696                                                          Memory Read.
01697                                                          Write of 1 will clear the corresponding error bit */
01698 #else
01699     uint64_t sbe_err                      : 1;
01700     uint64_t dbe_err                      : 1;
01701     uint64_t reserved_2_3                 : 2;
01702     uint64_t fadr                         : 28;
01703     uint64_t fsyn                         : 10;
01704     uint64_t reserved_42_63               : 22;
01705 #endif
01706     } s;
01707     struct cvmx_dfm_fnt_stat_s            cn63xx;
01708     struct cvmx_dfm_fnt_stat_s            cn63xxp1;
01709     struct cvmx_dfm_fnt_stat_s            cn66xx;
01710 };
01711 typedef union cvmx_dfm_fnt_stat cvmx_dfm_fnt_stat_t;

01713 /**
01714  * cvmx_dfm_ifb_cnt
01715  *
01716  * DFM_IFB_CNT  = Performance Counters
01717  *
01718  */
01719 union cvmx_dfm_ifb_cnt {
01720     uint64_t u64;
01721     struct cvmx_dfm_ifb_cnt_s {
01722 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01723     uint64_t ifbcnt                       : 64; /**< Performance Counter
01724                                                          64-bit counter that increments every
01725                                                          cycle there is something in the in-flight buffer.
01726                                                          Before using, clear counter via DFM_CONTROL.BWCNT. */
01727 #else
01728     uint64_t ifbcnt                       : 64;
01729 #endif
01730     } s;
01731     struct cvmx_dfm_ifb_cnt_s             cn63xx;
01732     struct cvmx_dfm_ifb_cnt_s             cn63xxp1;
01733     struct cvmx_dfm_ifb_cnt_s             cn66xx;

01737 /**
01738  * cvmx_dfm_modereg_params0
01739  *
01740  * Notes:
01741  * These parameters are written into the DDR3 MR0, MR1, MR2 and MR3 registers.
01742  *
01743  */
01744 union cvmx_dfm_modereg_params0 {
01745     uint64_t u64;
01746     struct cvmx_dfm_modereg_params0_s {
01747 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01748     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
01749     uint64_t ppd                          : 1;  /**< DLL Control for precharge powerdown
01750                                                          0 = Slow exit (DLL off)
01751                                                          1 = Fast exit (DLL on)
01752                                                          DFM writes this value to MR0[PPD] in the selected DDR3 parts
01753                                                          during power-up/init instruction sequencing.
01754                                                          See DFM_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK].
01755                                                          This value must equal the MR0[PPD] value in all the DDR3
01756                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
01757     uint64_t wrp                          : 3;  /**< Write recovery for auto precharge
01758                                                          Should be programmed to be equal to or greater than
01759                                                          RNDUP[tWR(ns)/tCYC(ns)]
01760                                                          000 = 5
01761                                                          001 = 5
01762                                                          010 = 6
01763                                                          011 = 7
01764                                                          100 = 8
01765                                                          101 = 10
01766                                                          110 = 12
01767                                                          111 = 14
01768                                                          DFM writes this value to MR0[WR] in the selected DDR3 parts
01769                                                          during power-up/init instruction sequencing.
01770                                                          See DFM_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK].
01771                                                          This value must equal the MR0[WR] value in all the DDR3
01772                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
01773     uint64_t dllr                         : 1;  /**< DLL Reset
01774                                                          DFM writes this value to MR0[DLL] in the selected DDR3 parts
01775                                                          during power-up/init instruction sequencing.
01776                                                          See DFM_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK].
01777                                                          The MR0[DLL] value must be 0 in all the DDR3
01778                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
01779     uint64_t tm                           : 1;  /**< Test Mode
01780                                                          DFM writes this value to MR0[TM] in the selected DDR3 parts
01781                                                          during power-up/init instruction sequencing.
01782                                                          See DFM_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK].
01783                                                          The MR0[TM] value must be 0 in all the DDR3
01784                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
01785     uint64_t rbt                          : 1;  /**< Read Burst Type
01786                                                          1 = interleaved (fixed)
01787                                                          DFM writes this value to MR0[RBT] in the selected DDR3 parts
01788                                                          during power-up/init instruction sequencing.
01789                                                          See DFM_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK].
01790                                                          The MR0[RBT] value must be 1 in all the DDR3
01791                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
01792     uint64_t cl                           : 4;  /**< CAS Latency
01793                                                          0010 = 5
01794                                                          0100 = 6
01795                                                          0110 = 7
01796                                                          1000 = 8
01797                                                          1010 = 9
01798                                                          1100 = 10
01799                                                          1110 = 11
01800                                                          0001 = 12
01801                                                          0011 = 13
01802                                                          0101 = 14
01803                                                          0111 = 15
01804                                                          1001 = 16
01805                                                          0000, 1011, 1101, 1111 = Reserved
01806                                                          DFM writes this value to MR0[CAS Latency / CL] in the selected DDR3 parts
01807                                                          during power-up/init instruction sequencing.
01808                                                          See DFM_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK].
01809                                                          This value must equal the MR0[CAS Latency / CL] value in all the DDR3
01810                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
01811     uint64_t bl                           : 2;  /**< Burst Length
01812                                                          0 = 8 (fixed)
01813                                                          DFM writes this value to MR0[BL] in the selected DDR3 parts
01814                                                          during power-up/init instruction sequencing.
01815                                                          See DFM_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK].
01816                                                          The MR0[BL] value must be 0 in all the DDR3
01817                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
01818     uint64_t qoff                         : 1;  /**< Qoff Enable
01819                                                          0 = enable
01820                                                          DFM writes this value to MR1[Qoff] in the selected DDR3 parts
01821                                                          during power-up/init and write-leveling instruction sequencing.
01822                                                          If DFM_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, DFM also writes
01823                                                          this value to MR1[Qoff] in all DRAM parts in DFM_CONFIG[INIT_STATUS] ranks during self-refresh
01824                                                          entry and exit instruction sequences.
01825                                                          See DFM_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
01826                                                          DFM_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT].
01827                                                          The MR1[Qoff] value must be 0 in all the DDR3
01828                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
01829     uint64_t tdqs                         : 1;  /**< TDQS Enable
01830                                                          0 = disable
01831                                                          DFM writes this value to MR1[TDQS] in the selected DDR3 parts
01832                                                          during power-up/init and write-leveling instruction sequencing.
01833                                                          If DFM_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, DFM also writes
01834                                                          this value to MR1[TDQS] in all DRAM parts in DFM_CONFIG[INIT_STATUS] ranks during self-refresh
01835                                                          entry and exit instruction sequences.
01836                                                          See DFM_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
01837                                                          DFM_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
01838     uint64_t wlev                         : 1;  /**< Write Leveling Enable
01839                                                          0 = disable
01840                                                          DFM writes MR1[Level]=0 in the selected DDR3 parts
01841                                                          during power-up/init and write-leveling instruction sequencing.
01842                                                          (DFM also writes MR1[Level]=1 at the beginning of a
01843                                                          write-leveling instruction sequence. Write-leveling can only be initiated via the
01844                                                          write-leveling instruction sequence.)
01845                                                          If DFM_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, DFM also writes
01846                                                          MR1[Level]=0 in all DRAM parts in DFM_CONFIG[INIT_STATUS] ranks during self-refresh
01847                                                          entry and exit instruction sequences.
01848                                                          See DFM_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
01849                                                          DFM_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
01850     uint64_t al                           : 2;  /**< Additive Latency
01851                                                          00 = 0
01852                                                          01 = CL-1
01853                                                          10 = CL-2
01854                                                          11 = Reserved
01855                                                          DFM writes this value to MR1[AL] in the selected DDR3 parts
01856                                                          during power-up/init and write-leveling instruction sequencing.
01857                                                          If DFM_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, DFM also writes
01858                                                          this value to MR1[AL] in all DRAM parts in DFM_CONFIG[INIT_STATUS] ranks during self-refresh
01859                                                          entry and exit instruction sequences.
01860                                                          See DFM_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
01861                                                          DFM_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT].
01862                                                          This value must equal the MR1[AL] value in all the DDR3
01863                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation.
01864                                                          See also DFM_CONTROL[POCAS]. */
01865     uint64_t dll                          : 1;  /**< DLL Enable
01866                                                          0 = enable
01867                                                          1 = disable
01868                                                          DFM writes this value to MR1[DLL] in the selected DDR3 parts
01869                                                          during power-up/init and write-leveling instruction sequencing.
01870                                                          If DFM_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, DFM also writes
01871                                                          this value to MR1[DLL] in all DRAM parts in DFM_CONFIG[INIT_STATUS] ranks during self-refresh
01872                                                          entry and exit instruction sequences.
01873                                                          See DFM_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
01874                                                          DFM_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT].
01875                                                          This value must equal the MR1[DLL] value in all the DDR3
01876                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation.
01877                                                          In dll-off mode, CL/CWL must be programmed
01878                                                          equal to 6/6, respectively, as per the DDR3 specifications. */
01879     uint64_t mpr                          : 1;  /**< MPR
01880                                                          DFM writes this value to MR3[MPR] in the selected DDR3 parts
01881                                                          during power-up/init and read-leveling instruction sequencing.
01882                                                          (DFM also writes MR3[MPR]=1 at the beginning of a
01883                                                          read-leveling instruction sequence. Read-leveling can only be initiated via the
01884                                                          read-leveling instruction sequence.)
01885                                                          See DFM_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK].
01886                                                          The MR3[MPR] value must be 0 in all the DDR3
01887                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
01888     uint64_t mprloc                       : 2;  /**< MPR Location
01889                                                          DFM writes this value to MR3[MPRLoc] in the selected DDR3 parts
01890                                                          during power-up/init and read-leveling instruction sequencing.
01891                                                          (DFM also writes MR3[MPRLoc]=0 at the beginning of the
01892                                                          read-leveling instruction sequence.)
01893                                                          See DFM_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK].
01894                                                          The MR3[MPRLoc] value must be 0 in all the DDR3
01895                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
01896     uint64_t cwl                          : 3;  /**< CAS Write Latency
01897                                                          - 000: 5
01898                                                          - 001: 6
01899                                                          - 010: 7
01900                                                          - 011: 8
01901                                                          - 100: 9
01902                                                          - 101: 10
01903                                                          - 110: 11
01904                                                          - 111: 12
01905                                                          DFM writes this value to MR2[CWL] in the selected DDR3 parts
01906                                                          during power-up/init instruction sequencing.
01907                                                          If DFM_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, DFM also writes
01908                                                          this value to MR2[CWL] in all DRAM parts in DFM_CONFIG[INIT_STATUS] ranks during self-refresh
01909                                                          entry and exit instruction sequences.
01910                                                          See DFM_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
01911                                                          DFM_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT].
01912                                                          This value must equal the MR2[CWL] value in all the DDR3
01913                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
01914 #else
01915     uint64_t cwl                          : 3;
01916     uint64_t mprloc                       : 2;
01917     uint64_t mpr                          : 1;
01918     uint64_t dll                          : 1;
01919     uint64_t al                           : 2;
01920     uint64_t wlev                         : 1;
01921     uint64_t tdqs                         : 1;
01922     uint64_t qoff                         : 1;
01923     uint64_t bl                           : 2;
01924     uint64_t cl                           : 4;
01925     uint64_t rbt                          : 1;
01926     uint64_t tm                           : 1;
01927     uint64_t dllr                         : 1;
01928     uint64_t wrp                          : 3;
01929     uint64_t ppd                          : 1;
01930     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
01931 #endif
01932     } s;

01934     struct cvmx_dfm_modereg_params0_s     cn63xxp1;

02203 /**
02204  * cvmx_dfm_reset_ctl
02205  *
02206  * Specify the RSL base addresses for the block
02207  *
02208  *
02209  * Notes:
02210  * DDR3RST - DDR3 DRAM parts have a new RESET#
02211  * pin that wasn't present in DDR2 parts. The
02212  * DDR3RST CSR field controls the assertion of
02213  * the new 6xxx pin that attaches to RESET#.
02214  * When DDR3RST is set, 6xxx asserts RESET#.
02215  * When DDR3RST is clear, 6xxx de-asserts
02216  * RESET#.
02217  *
02218  * DDR3RST is set on a cold reset. Warm and
02219  * soft chip resets do not affect the DDR3RST
02220  * value. Outside of cold reset, only software
02221  * CSR writes change the DDR3RST value.
02222  */
02223 union cvmx_dfm_reset_ctl {
02224     uint64_t u64;
02225     struct cvmx_dfm_reset_ctl_s {
02226 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02227     uint64_t reserved_4_63                : 60;
02228     uint64_t ddr3psv                      : 1;  /**< Must be zero */
02229     uint64_t ddr3psoft                    : 1;  /**< Must be zero */
02230     uint64_t ddr3pwarm                    : 1;  /**< Must be zero */
02231     uint64_t ddr3rst                      : 1;  /**< Memory Reset
02232                                                          0 = Reset asserted
02233                                                          1 = Reset de-asserted */
02234 #else
02235     uint64_t ddr3rst                      : 1;
02236     uint64_t ddr3pwarm                    : 1;
02237     uint64_t ddr3psoft                    : 1;
02238     uint64_t ddr3psv                      : 1;
02239     uint64_t reserved_4_63                : 60;
02240 #endif
02241     } s;
02242     struct cvmx_dfm_reset_ctl_s           cn63xx;
02243     struct cvmx_dfm_reset_ctl_s           cn63xxp1;
02244     struct cvmx_dfm_reset_ctl_s           cn66xx;
02245 };

02257                                                          during read-leveling if DFM_RLEVEL_RANKi[BYTE*<1:0>] = 3
02258                                                          DELAY_UNLOAD_3 should normally be set, particularly at higher speeds. */

02264                                                          DELAY_UNLOAD_1 should normally not be set. */

02266                                                          during read-leveling if DFM_RLEVEL_RANKi[BYTE*<1:0>] = 0
02267                                                          DELAY_UNLOAD_0 should normally not be set. */
02268     uint64_t bitmask                      : 8;  /**< Mask to select bit lanes on which read-leveling

02276                                                          deskew setting instead of the middle of the largest
02277                                                          contiguous sequence of 1's in the bitmask */
02278     uint64_t byte                         : 4;  /**< 0 <= BYTE <= 1
02279                                                          Byte index for which bitmask results are saved
02280                                                          in DFM_RLEVEL_DBG */
02281 #else
02282     uint64_t byte                         : 4;
02283     uint64_t offset                       : 4;
02284     uint64_t offset_en                    : 1;
02285     uint64_t or_dis                       : 1;
02286     uint64_t bitmask                      : 8;
02287     uint64_t delay_unload_0               : 1;
02288     uint64_t delay_unload_1               : 1;
02289     uint64_t delay_unload_2               : 1;
02290     uint64_t delay_unload_3               : 1;
02291     uint64_t reserved_22_63               : 42;
02292 #endif

02317 /**
02318  * cvmx_dfm_rlevel_dbg
02319  *
02320  * Notes:
02321  * A given read of DFM_RLEVEL_DBG returns the read-leveling pass/fail results for all possible
02322  * delay settings (i.e. the BITMASK) for only one byte in the last rank that the HW read-leveled.
02323  * DFM_RLEVEL_CTL[BYTE] selects the particular byte.
02324  * To get these pass/fail results for another different rank, you must run the hardware read-leveling
02325  * again. For example, it is possible to get the BITMASK results for every byte of every rank
02326  * if you run read-leveling separately for each rank, probing DFM_RLEVEL_DBG between each
02327  * read-leveling.
02328  */
02329 union cvmx_dfm_rlevel_dbg {
02330     uint64_t u64;
02331     struct cvmx_dfm_rlevel_dbg_s {
02332 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02333     uint64_t bitmask                      : 64; /**< Bitmask generated during deskew settings sweep
02334                                                          BITMASK[n]=0 means deskew setting n failed
02335                                                          BITMASK[n]=1 means deskew setting n passed
02336                                                          for 0 <= n <= 63 */
02337 #else
02338     uint64_t bitmask                      : 64;
02339 #endif
02340     } s;
02341     struct cvmx_dfm_rlevel_dbg_s          cn63xx;
02342     struct cvmx_dfm_rlevel_dbg_s          cn63xxp1;
02343     struct cvmx_dfm_rlevel_dbg_s          cn66xx;
02344 };
02345 typedef union cvmx_dfm_rlevel_dbg cvmx_dfm_rlevel_dbg_t;
02346 
02347 /**
02348  * cvmx_dfm_rlevel_rank#
02349  *
02350  * Notes:
02351  * This is TWO CSRs per DFM, one per each rank.
02352  *
02353  * Deskew setting is measured in units of 1/4 FCLK, so the above BYTE* values can range over 16 FCLKs.
02354  *
02355  * Each CSR is written by HW during a read-leveling sequence for the rank. (HW sets STATUS==3 after HW read-leveling completes for the rank.)
02356  * If HW is unable to find a match per DFM_RLEVEL_CTL[OFFSET_EN] and DFM_RLEVEL_CTL[OFFSET], then HW will set DFM_RLEVEL_RANKn[BYTE*<5:0>]
02357  * to 0.
02358  *
02359  * Each CSR may also be written by SW, but not while a read-leveling sequence is in progress. (HW sets STATUS==1 after a CSR write.)
02360  *
02361  * SW initiates a HW read-leveling sequence by programming DFM_RLEVEL_CTL and writing INIT_START=1 with SEQUENCE=1 in DFM_CONFIG.
02362  * See DFM_RLEVEL_CTL.
02363  */
02364 union cvmx_dfm_rlevel_rankx {
02365     uint64_t u64;
02366     struct cvmx_dfm_rlevel_rankx_s {
02367 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02368     uint64_t reserved_56_63               : 8;
02369     uint64_t status                       : 2;  /**< Indicates status of the read-levelling and where
02370                                                          the BYTE* programmings in <35:0> came from:
02371                                                          0 = BYTE* values are their reset value
02372                                                          1 = BYTE* values were set via a CSR write to this register
02373                                                          2 = read-leveling sequence currently in progress (BYTE* values are unpredictable)
02374                                                          3 = BYTE* values came from a complete read-leveling sequence */
02375     uint64_t reserved_12_53               : 42;
02376     uint64_t byte1                        : 6;  /**< Deskew setting */
02377     uint64_t byte0                        : 6;  /**< Deskew setting */
02378 #else
02379     uint64_t byte0                        : 6;
02380     uint64_t byte1                        : 6;
02381     uint64_t reserved_12_53               : 42;
02382     uint64_t status                       : 2;
02383     uint64_t reserved_56_63               : 8;
02384 #endif
02385     } s;
02386     struct cvmx_dfm_rlevel_rankx_s        cn63xx;
02387     struct cvmx_dfm_rlevel_rankx_s        cn63xxp1;
02388     struct cvmx_dfm_rlevel_rankx_s        cn66xx;
02389 };
02390 typedef union cvmx_dfm_rlevel_rankx cvmx_dfm_rlevel_rankx_t;
02391 
02392 /**
02393  * cvmx_dfm_rodt_mask
02394  *
02395  * DFM_RODT_MASK = DFM Read OnDieTermination mask
02396  * System designers may desire to terminate DQ/DQS/DM lines for higher frequency DDR operations
02397  * especially on a multi-rank system. DDR3 DQ/DM/DQS I/O's have built in
02398  * Termination resistor that can be turned on or off by the controller, after meeting tAOND and tAOF
02399  * timing requirements. Each Rank has its own ODT pin that fans out to all the memory parts
02400  * in that rank. System designers may prefer different combinations of ODT ON's for reads
02401  * into different ranks. Octeon supports full programmability by way of the mask register below.
02402  * Each Rank position has its own 8-bit programmable field.
02403  * When the controller does a read to that rank, it sets the 4 ODT pins to the MASK pins below.
02404  * For eg., When doing a read into Rank0, a system designer may desire to terminate the lines
02405  * with the resistor on Dimm0/Rank1. The mask RODT_D0_R0 would then be [00000010].
02406  * Octeon drives the appropriate mask values on the ODT pins by default. If this feature is not
02407  * required, write 0 in this register. Note that, as per the DDR3 specifications, the ODT pin
02408  * for the rank that is being read should always be 0.
02409  *
02410  * Notes:
02411  * - Notice that when there is only one rank, all valid fields must be zero.  This is because there is no
02412  * "other" rank to terminate lines for.  Read ODT is meant for multirank systems.
02413  * - For a two rank system and a read op to rank0: use RODT_D0_R0<1> to terminate lines on rank1.
02414  * - For a two rank system and a read op to rank1: use RODT_D0_R1<0> to terminate lines on rank0.
02415  * - Therefore, when a given RANK is selected, the RODT mask for that RANK is used.
02416  *
02417  * DFM always reads 128-bit words independently via one read CAS operation per word.
02418  * When a RODT mask bit is set, DFM asserts the OCTEON ODT output
02419  * pin(s) starting (CL - CWL) CK's after the read CAS operation. Then, OCTEON
02420  * normally continues to assert the ODT output pin(s) for 5+DFM_CONTROL[RODT_BPRCH] more CK's
02421  * - for a total of 6+DFM_CONTROL[RODT_BPRCH] CK's for the entire 128-bit read -
02422  * satisfying the 6 CK DDR3 ODTH8 requirements.
02423  *
02424  * But it is possible for OCTEON to issue two 128-bit reads separated by as few as
02425  * RtR = 4 or 5 (6 if DFM_CONTROL[RODT_BPRCH]=1) CK's. In that case, OCTEON asserts the ODT output pin(s)
02426  * for the RODT mask of the first 128-bit read for RtR CK's, then asserts
02427  * the ODT output pin(s) for the RODT mask of the second 128-bit read for 6+DFM_CONTROL[RODT_BPRCH] CK's
02428  * (or less if a third 128-bit read follows within 4 or 5 (or 6) CK's of this second 128-bit read).
02429  * Note that it may be necessary to force DFM to space back-to-back 128-bit reads
02430  * to different ranks apart by at least 6+DFM_CONTROL[RODT_BPRCH] CK's to prevent DDR3 ODTH8 violations.
02431  */
02432 union cvmx_dfm_rodt_mask {
02433     uint64_t u64;
02434     struct cvmx_dfm_rodt_mask_s {
02435 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02436     uint64_t rodt_d3_r1                   : 8;  /**< Must be zero. */
02437     uint64_t rodt_d3_r0                   : 8;  /**< Must be zero. */
02438     uint64_t rodt_d2_r1                   : 8;  /**< Must be zero. */
02439     uint64_t rodt_d2_r0                   : 8;  /**< Must be zero. */
02440     uint64_t rodt_d1_r1                   : 8;  /**< Must be zero. */
02441     uint64_t rodt_d1_r0                   : 8;  /**< Must be zero. */
02442     uint64_t rodt_d0_r1                   : 8;  /**< Read ODT mask RANK1
02443                                                          RODT_D0_R1<7:1> must be zero in all cases.
02444                                                          RODT_D0_R1<0> must also be zero if RANK_ENA is not set. */
02445     uint64_t rodt_d0_r0                   : 8;  /**< Read ODT mask RANK0
02446                                                          RODT_D0_R0<7:2,0> must be zero in all cases.
02447                                                          RODT_D0_R0<1> must also be zero if RANK_ENA is not set. */
02448 #else
02449     uint64_t rodt_d0_r0                   : 8;
02450     uint64_t rodt_d0_r1                   : 8;
02451     uint64_t rodt_d1_r0                   : 8;
02452     uint64_t rodt_d1_r1                   : 8;
02453     uint64_t rodt_d2_r0                   : 8;
02454     uint64_t rodt_d2_r1                   : 8;
02455     uint64_t rodt_d3_r0                   : 8;
02456     uint64_t rodt_d3_r1                   : 8;
02457 #endif
02458     } s;
02459     struct cvmx_dfm_rodt_mask_s           cn63xx;
02460     struct cvmx_dfm_rodt_mask_s           cn63xxp1;
02461     struct cvmx_dfm_rodt_mask_s           cn66xx;
02462 };
02463 typedef union cvmx_dfm_rodt_mask cvmx_dfm_rodt_mask_t;
02464 
02465 /**
02466  * cvmx_dfm_slot_ctl0
02467  *
02468  * DFM_SLOT_CTL0 = DFM Slot Control0
02469  * This register is an assortment of various control fields needed by the memory controller
02470  *
02471  * Notes:
02472  * HW will update this register if SW has not previously written to it and when any of DFM_RLEVEL_RANKn, DFM_WLEVEL_RANKn, DFM_CONTROL and
02473  * DFM_MODEREG_PARAMS0 change.Ideally, this register should only be read after DFM has been initialized and DFM_RLEVEL_RANKn, DFM_WLEVEL_RANKn
02474  * have valid data.
02475  * R2W_INIT has 1 extra CK cycle built in for odt settling/channel turnaround time.
02476  */
02477 union cvmx_dfm_slot_ctl0 {
02478     uint64_t u64;
02479     struct cvmx_dfm_slot_ctl0_s {
02480 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02481     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
02482     uint64_t w2w_init                     : 6;  /**< Write-to-write spacing control
02483                                                          for back to back accesses to the same rank and dimm */
02484     uint64_t w2r_init                     : 6;  /**< Write-to-read spacing control
02485                                                          for back to back accesses to the same rank and dimm */
02486     uint64_t r2w_init                     : 6;  /**< Read-to-write spacing control
02487                                                          for back to back accesses to the same rank and dimm */
02488     uint64_t r2r_init                     : 6;  /**< Read-to-read spacing control
02489                                                          for back to back accesses to the same rank and dimm */
02490 #else
02491     uint64_t r2r_init                     : 6;
02492     uint64_t r2w_init                     : 6;
02493     uint64_t w2r_init                     : 6;
02494     uint64_t w2w_init                     : 6;
02495     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
02496 #endif
02497     } s;
02498     struct cvmx_dfm_slot_ctl0_s           cn63xx;
02499     struct cvmx_dfm_slot_ctl0_s           cn63xxp1;
02500     struct cvmx_dfm_slot_ctl0_s           cn66xx;
02501 };
02502 typedef union cvmx_dfm_slot_ctl0 cvmx_dfm_slot_ctl0_t;
02503 
02504 /**
02505  * cvmx_dfm_slot_ctl1
02506  *
02507  * DFM_SLOT_CTL1 = DFM Slot Control1
02508  * This register is an assortment of various control fields needed by the memory controller
02509  *
02510  * Notes:
02511  * HW will update this register if SW has not previously written to it and when any of DFM_RLEVEL_RANKn, DFM_WLEVEL_RANKn, DFM_CONTROL and
02512  * DFM_MODEREG_PARAMS0 change.Ideally, this register should only be read after DFM has been initialized and DFM_RLEVEL_RANKn, DFM_WLEVEL_RANKn
02513  * have valid data.
02514  * R2W_XRANK_INIT, W2R_XRANK_INIT have 1 extra CK cycle built in for odt settling/channel turnaround time.
02515  */
02516 union cvmx_dfm_slot_ctl1 {
02517     uint64_t u64;
02518     struct cvmx_dfm_slot_ctl1_s {
02519 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02520     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
02521     uint64_t w2w_xrank_init               : 6;  /**< Write-to-write spacing control
02522                                                          for back to back accesses across ranks of the same dimm */
02523     uint64_t w2r_xrank_init               : 6;  /**< Write-to-read spacing control
02524                                                          for back to back accesses across ranks of the same dimm */
02525     uint64_t r2w_xrank_init               : 6;  /**< Read-to-write spacing control
02526                                                          for back to back accesses across ranks of the same dimm */
02527     uint64_t r2r_xrank_init               : 6;  /**< Read-to-read spacing control
02528                                                          for back to back accesses across ranks of the same dimm */
02529 #else
02530     uint64_t r2r_xrank_init               : 6;
02531     uint64_t r2w_xrank_init               : 6;
02532     uint64_t w2r_xrank_init               : 6;
02533     uint64_t w2w_xrank_init               : 6;
02534     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
02535 #endif
02536     } s;
02537     struct cvmx_dfm_slot_ctl1_s           cn63xx;
02538     struct cvmx_dfm_slot_ctl1_s           cn63xxp1;
02539     struct cvmx_dfm_slot_ctl1_s           cn66xx;
02540 };
02541 typedef union cvmx_dfm_slot_ctl1 cvmx_dfm_slot_ctl1_t;
02542

02553                                                          + (RNDUP[tRTP(ns)/tCYC(ns)])-4)-1,
02554                                                          where tRP, tRTP are from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
02555                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
02556                                                          TYP tRP=10-15ns
02557                                                          TYP tRTP=max(4nCK, 7.5ns) */

02561                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
02562                                                          TYP=max(5nCK, 10ns) */
02563     uint64_t trp                          : 4;  /**< Indicates tRP constraints.
02564                                                          Set [TRP_EXT[0:0], TRP[3:0]] (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRP(ns)/tCYC(ns)]

02574                                                          TYP=2 (equivalent to 512) */

02577                                                          where tDLLk is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
02578                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
02579                                                          TYP=2 (equivalent to 512)
02580                                                          This parameter is used in self-refresh exit
02581                                                          and assumed to be greater than tRFC */

02583                                                          Set TMOD (CSR field) = RNDUP[tMOD(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,

02605                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
02606                                                          TYP=4 (equivalent to 64) */

02769 /**
02770  * cvmx_dfm_timing_params1
02771  */
02772 union cvmx_dfm_timing_params1 {
02773     uint64_t u64;
02774     struct cvmx_dfm_timing_params1_s {
02775 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02776     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
02777     uint64_t tras_ext                     : 1;  /**< Indicates tRAS constraints.
02778                                                          Set [TRAS_EXT[0:0], TRAS[4:0]] (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRAS(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
02779                                                          where tRAS is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
02780                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
02781                                                          TYP=35ns-9*tREFI
02782                                                              - 000000: RESERVED
02783                                                              - 000001: 2 tCYC
02784                                                              - 000010: 3 tCYC
02785                                                              - ...
02786                                                              - 111111: 64 tCYC */
02787     uint64_t txpdll                       : 5;  /**< Indicates tXPDLL constraints.
02788                                                          Set TXPDLL (CSR field) = RNDUP[tXPDLL(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
02789                                                          where tXPDLL is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
02790                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
02791                                                          TYP=max(10nCK, 24ns) */
02792     uint64_t tfaw                         : 5;  /**< Indicates tFAW constraints.
02793                                                          Set TFAW (CSR field) = RNDUP[tFAW(ns)/(4*tCYC(ns))],
02794                                                          where tFAW is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
02795                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
02796                                                          TYP=30-40ns */
02797     uint64_t twldqsen                     : 4;  /**< Indicates tWLDQSEN constraints.
02798                                                          Set TWLDQSEN (CSR field) = RNDUP[tWLDQSEN(ns)/(4*tCYC(ns))],

02800                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
02801                                                          TYP=max(25nCK) */
02802     uint64_t twlmrd                       : 4;  /**< Indicates tWLMRD constraints.
02803                                                          Set TWLMRD (CSR field) = RNDUP[tWLMRD(ns)/(4*tCYC(ns))],
02804                                                          where tWLMRD is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
02805                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
02806                                                          TYP=max(40nCK) */
02807     uint64_t txp                          : 3;  /**< Indicates tXP constraints.
02808                                                          Set TXP (CSR field) = RNDUP[tXP(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
02809                                                          where tXP is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
02810                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
02811                                                          TYP=max(3nCK, 7.5ns) */
02812     uint64_t trrd                         : 3;  /**< Indicates tRRD constraints.
02813                                                          Set TRRD (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRRD(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-2,
02814                                                          where tRRD is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
02815                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
02816                                                          TYP=max(4nCK, 10ns)
02817                                                             - 000: RESERVED
02818                                                             - 001: 3 tCYC
02819                                                             - ...
02820                                                             - 110: 8 tCYC
02821                                                             - 111: 9 tCYC */
02822     uint64_t trfc                         : 5;  /**< Indicates tRFC constraints.
02823                                                          Set TRFC (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRFC(ns)/(8*tCYC(ns))],
02824                                                          where tRFC is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
02825                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
02826                                                          TYP=90-350ns
02827                                                               - 00000: RESERVED
02828                                                               - 00001: 8 tCYC
02829                                                               - 00010: 16 tCYC
02830                                                               - 00011: 24 tCYC
02831                                                               - 00100: 32 tCYC
02832                                                               - ...
02833                                                               - 11110: 240 tCYC
02834                                                               - 11111: 248 tCYC */
02835     uint64_t twtr                         : 4;  /**< Indicates tWTR constraints.
02836                                                          Set TWTR (CSR field) = RNDUP[tWTR(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
02837                                                          where tWTR is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
02838                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
02839                                                          TYP=max(4nCK, 7.5ns)
02840                                                              - 0000: RESERVED
02841                                                              - 0001: 2
02842                                                              - ...
02843                                                              - 0111: 8
02844                                                              - 1000-1111: RESERVED */
02845     uint64_t trcd                         : 4;  /**< Indicates tRCD constraints.
02846                                                          Set TRCD (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRCD(ns)/tCYC(ns)],
02847                                                          where tRCD is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
02848                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
02849                                                          TYP=10-15ns
02850                                                              - 0000: RESERVED
02851                                                              - 0001: 2 (2 is the smallest value allowed)
02852                                                              - 0002: 2
02853                                                              - ...
02854                                                              - 1001: 9
02855                                                              - 1010-1111: RESERVED
02856                                                          In 2T mode, make this register TRCD-1, not going
02857                                                          below 2. */
02858     uint64_t tras                         : 5;  /**< Indicates tRAS constraints.
02859                                                          Set [TRAS_EXT[0:0], TRAS[4:0]] (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRAS(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
02860                                                          where tRAS is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
02861                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
02862                                                          TYP=35ns-9*tREFI
02863                                                              - 000000: RESERVED
02864                                                              - 000001: 2 tCYC
02865                                                              - 000010: 3 tCYC
02866                                                              - ...
02867                                                              - 111111: 64 tCYC */
02868     uint64_t tmprr                        : 4;  /**< Indicates tMPRR constraints.
02869                                                          Set TMPRR (CSR field) = RNDUP[tMPRR(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
02870                                                          where tMPRR is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
02871                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
02872                                                          TYP=1nCK */
02873 #else
02874     uint64_t tmprr                        : 4;
02875     uint64_t tras                         : 5;
02876     uint64_t trcd                         : 4;
02877     uint64_t twtr                         : 4;
02878     uint64_t trfc                         : 5;
02879     uint64_t trrd                         : 3;
02880     uint64_t txp                          : 3;
02881     uint64_t twlmrd                       : 4;
02882     uint64_t twldqsen                     : 4;

02884     uint64_t txpdll                       : 5;

02924                                                             - 001: 3 tCYC
02925                                                             - ...
02926                                                             - 110: 8 tCYC
02927                                                             - 111: 9 tCYC */
02928     uint64_t trfc                         : 5;  /**< Indicates tRFC constraints.
02929                                                          Set TRFC (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRFC(ns)/(8*tCYC(ns))],
02930                                                          where tRFC is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
02931                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
02932                                                          TYP=90-350ns
02933                                                               - 00000: RESERVED
02934                                                               - 00001: 8 tCYC

02943                                                          where tWTR is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)

02953                                                          where tRCD is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
02954                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
02955                                                          TYP=10-15ns

02957                                                              - 0001: 2 (2 is the smallest value allowed)
02958                                                              - 0002: 2

02976                                                          where tMPRR is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
02977                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
02978                                                          TYP=1nCK */
02979 #else

03001 union cvmx_dfm_wlevel_ctl {
03002     uint64_t u64;
03003     struct cvmx_dfm_wlevel_ctl_s {
03004 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03005     uint64_t reserved_22_63               : 42;
03006     uint64_t rtt_nom                      : 3;  /**< RTT_NOM
03007                                                          DFM writes a decoded value to MR1[Rtt_Nom] of the rank during
03008                                                          write leveling. Per JEDEC DDR3 specifications,
03009                                                          only values MR1[Rtt_Nom] = 1 (RQZ/4), 2 (RQZ/2), or 3 (RQZ/6)
03010                                                          are allowed during write leveling with output buffer enabled.
03011                                                          000 : DFM writes 001 (RZQ/4)   to MR1[Rtt_Nom]
03012                                                          001 : DFM writes 010 (RZQ/2)   to MR1[Rtt_Nom]
03013                                                          010 : DFM writes 011 (RZQ/6)   to MR1[Rtt_Nom]
03014                                                          011 : DFM writes 100 (RZQ/12)  to MR1[Rtt_Nom]
03015                                                          100 : DFM writes 101 (RZQ/8)   to MR1[Rtt_Nom]
03016                                                          101 : DFM writes 110 (Rsvd)    to MR1[Rtt_Nom]
03017                                                          110 : DFM writes 111 (Rsvd)    to  MR1[Rtt_Nom]
03018                                                          111 : DFM writes 000 (Disabled) to MR1[Rtt_Nom] */
03019     uint64_t bitmask                      : 8;  /**< Mask to select bit lanes on which write-leveling
03020                                                          feedback is returned when OR_DIS is set to 1 */
03021     uint64_t or_dis                       : 1;  /**< Disable or'ing of bits in a byte lane when computing
03022                                                          the write-leveling bitmask */
03023     uint64_t sset                         : 1;  /**< Run write-leveling on the current setting only. */
03024     uint64_t lanemask                     : 9;  /**< One-hot mask to select byte lane to be leveled by
03025                                                          the write-leveling sequence
03026                                                          Used with x16 parts where the upper and lower byte
03027                                                          lanes need to be leveled independently
03028                                                          LANEMASK<8:2> must be zero. */
03029 #else
03030     uint64_t lanemask                     : 9;
03031     uint64_t sset                         : 1;
03032     uint64_t or_dis                       : 1;
03033     uint64_t bitmask                      : 8;
03034     uint64_t rtt_nom                      : 3;
03035     uint64_t reserved_22_63               : 42;
03036 #endif

03058 /**
03059  * cvmx_dfm_wlevel_dbg
03060  *
03061  * Notes:
03062  * A given write of DFM_WLEVEL_DBG returns the write-leveling pass/fail results for all possible
03063  * delay settings (i.e. the BITMASK) for only one byte in the last rank that the HW write-leveled.
03064  * DFM_WLEVEL_DBG[BYTE] selects the particular byte.
03065  * To get these pass/fail results for another different rank, you must run the hardware write-leveling
03066  * again. For example, it is possible to get the BITMASK results for every byte of every rank
03067  * if you run write-leveling separately for each rank, probing DFM_WLEVEL_DBG between each
03068  * write-leveling.
03069  */
03070 union cvmx_dfm_wlevel_dbg {
03071     uint64_t u64;
03072     struct cvmx_dfm_wlevel_dbg_s {
03073 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03074     uint64_t reserved_12_63               : 52;
03075     uint64_t bitmask                      : 8;  /**< Bitmask generated during deskew settings sweep
03076                                                          if DFM_WLEVEL_CTL[SSET]=0
03077                                                            BITMASK[n]=0 means deskew setting n failed
03078                                                            BITMASK[n]=1 means deskew setting n passed
03079                                                            for 0 <= n <= 7
03080                                                            BITMASK contains the first 8 results of the total 16
03081                                                            collected by DFM during the write-leveling sequence
03082                                                          else if DFM_WLEVEL_CTL[SSET]=1
03083                                                            BITMASK[0]=0 means curr deskew setting failed
03084                                                            BITMASK[0]=1 means curr deskew setting passed */
03085     uint64_t byte                         : 4;  /**< 0 <= BYTE <= 8 */
03086 #else
03087     uint64_t byte                         : 4;
03088     uint64_t bitmask                      : 8;
03089     uint64_t reserved_12_63               : 52;
03090 #endif
03091     } s;
03092     struct cvmx_dfm_wlevel_dbg_s          cn63xx;
03093     struct cvmx_dfm_wlevel_dbg_s          cn63xxp1;
03094     struct cvmx_dfm_wlevel_dbg_s          cn66xx;
03095 };
03096 typedef union cvmx_dfm_wlevel_dbg cvmx_dfm_wlevel_dbg_t;
03097 
03098 /**
03099  * cvmx_dfm_wlevel_rank#
03100  *
03101  * Notes:
03102  * This is TWO CSRs per DFM, one per each rank. (front bunk/back bunk)
03103  *
03104  * Deskew setting is measured in units of 1/8 FCLK, so the above BYTE* values can range over 4 FCLKs.
03105  *
03106  * Assuming DFM_WLEVEL_CTL[SSET]=0, the BYTE*<2:0> values are not used during write-leveling, and
03107  * they are over-written by the hardware as part of the write-leveling sequence. (HW sets STATUS==3
03108  * after HW write-leveling completes for the rank). SW needs to set BYTE*<4:3> bits.
03109  *
03110  * Each CSR may also be written by SW, but not while a write-leveling sequence is in progress. (HW sets STATUS==1 after a CSR write.)
03111  *
03112  * SW initiates a HW write-leveling sequence by programming DFM_WLEVEL_CTL and writing RANKMASK and INIT_START=1 with SEQUENCE=6 in DFM_CONFIG.
03113  * DFM will then step through and accumulate write leveling results for 8 unique delay settings (twice), starting at a delay of
03114  * DFM_WLEVEL_RANKn[BYTE*<4:3>]*8 CK increasing by 1/8 CK each setting. HW will then set DFM_WLEVEL_RANKn[BYTE*<2:0>] to indicate the
03115  * first write leveling result of '1' that followed a reslt of '0' during the sequence by searching for a '1100' pattern in the generated
03116  * bitmask, except that DFM will always write DFM_WLEVEL_RANKn[BYTE*<0>]=0. If HW is unable to find a match for a '1100' pattern, then HW will
03117  * set DFM_WLEVEL_RANKn[BYTE*<2:0>] to 4.
03118  * See DFM_WLEVEL_CTL.
03119  */
03120 union cvmx_dfm_wlevel_rankx {
03121     uint64_t u64;
03122     struct cvmx_dfm_wlevel_rankx_s {
03123 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03124     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
03125     uint64_t status                       : 2;  /**< Indicates status of the write-leveling and where
03126                                                          the BYTE* programmings in <44:0> came from:
03127                                                          0 = BYTE* values are their reset value
03128                                                          1 = BYTE* values were set via a CSR write to this register
03129                                                          2 = write-leveling sequence currently in progress (BYTE* values are unpredictable)
03130                                                          3 = BYTE* values came from a complete write-leveling sequence, irrespective of
03131                                                              which lanes are masked via DFM_WLEVEL_CTL[LANEMASK] */
03132     uint64_t reserved_10_44               : 35;
03133     uint64_t byte1                        : 5;  /**< Deskew setting
03134                                                          Bit 0 of BYTE1 must be zero during normal operation */
03135     uint64_t byte0                        : 5;  /**< Deskew setting
03136                                                          Bit 0 of BYTE0 must be zero during normal operation */
03137 #else
03138     uint64_t byte0                        : 5;
03139     uint64_t byte1                        : 5;
03140     uint64_t reserved_10_44               : 35;
03141     uint64_t status                       : 2;
03142     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
03143 #endif
03144     } s;
03145     struct cvmx_dfm_wlevel_rankx_s        cn63xx;
03146     struct cvmx_dfm_wlevel_rankx_s        cn63xxp1;
03147     struct cvmx_dfm_wlevel_rankx_s        cn66xx;
03148 };
03149 typedef union cvmx_dfm_wlevel_rankx cvmx_dfm_wlevel_rankx_t;
03150 
03151 /**
03152  * cvmx_dfm_wodt_mask
03153  *
03154  * DFM_WODT_MASK = DFM Write OnDieTermination mask
03155  * System designers may desire to terminate DQ/DQS/DM lines for higher frequency DDR operations
03156  * especially on a multi-rank system. DDR3 DQ/DM/DQS I/O's have built in
03157  * Termination resistor that can be turned on or off by the controller, after meeting tAOND and tAOF
03158  * timing requirements. Each Rank has its own ODT pin that fans out to all the memory parts
03159  * in that rank. System designers may prefer different combinations of ODT ON's for writes
03160  * into different ranks. Octeon supports full programmability by way of the mask register below.
03161  * Each Rank position has its own 8-bit programmable field.
03162  * When the controller does a write to that rank, it sets the 4 ODT pins to the MASK pins below.
03163  * For eg., When doing a write into Rank0, a system designer may desire to terminate the lines
03164  * with the resistor on Dimm0/Rank1. The mask WODT_D0_R0 would then be [00000010].
03165  * Octeon drives the appropriate mask values on the ODT pins by default. If this feature is not
03166  * required, write 0 in this register.
03167  *
03168  * Notes:
03169  * - DFM_WODT_MASK functions a little differently than DFM_RODT_MASK.  While, in DFM_RODT_MASK, the other
03170  * rank(s) are ODT-ed, in DFM_WODT_MASK, the rank in which the write CAS is issued can be ODT-ed as well.
03171  * - For a two rank system and a write op to rank0: use RODT_D0_R0<1:0> to terminate lines on rank1 and/or rank0.
03172  * - For a two rank system and a write op to rank1: use RODT_D0_R1<1:0> to terminate lines on rank1 and/or rank0.
03173  * - When a given RANK is selected, the WODT mask for that RANK is used.
03174  *
03175  * DFM always writes 128-bit words independently via one write CAS operation per word.
03176  * When a WODT mask bit is set, DFM asserts the OCTEON ODT output pin(s) starting the same cycle
03177  * as the write CAS operation. Then, OCTEON normally continues to assert the ODT output pin(s) for five
03178  * more cycles - for a total of 6 cycles for the entire word write - satisfying the 6 cycle DDR3
03179  * ODTH8 requirements. But it is possible for DFM to issue two word writes  separated by as few
03180  * as WtW = 4 or 5 cycles. In that case, DFM asserts the ODT output pin(s) for the WODT mask of the
03181  * first word write for WtW cycles, then asserts the ODT output pin(s) for the WODT mask of the
03182  * second write for 6 cycles (or less if a third word write follows within 4 or 5
03183  * cycles of this second word write). Note that it may be necessary to force DFM to space back-to-back
03184  * word writes to different ranks apart by at least 6 cycles to prevent DDR3 ODTH8 violations.
03185  */
03186 union cvmx_dfm_wodt_mask {
03187     uint64_t u64;
03188     struct cvmx_dfm_wodt_mask_s {
03189 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03190     uint64_t wodt_d3_r1                   : 8;  /**< Not used by DFM. */
03191     uint64_t wodt_d3_r0                   : 8;  /**< Not used by DFM. */
03192     uint64_t wodt_d2_r1                   : 8;  /**< Not used by DFM. */
03193     uint64_t wodt_d2_r0                   : 8;  /**< Not used by DFM. */
03194     uint64_t wodt_d1_r1                   : 8;  /**< Not used by DFM. */
03195     uint64_t wodt_d1_r0                   : 8;  /**< Not used by DFM. */
03196     uint64_t wodt_d0_r1                   : 8;  /**< Write ODT mask RANK1
03197                                                          WODT_D0_R1<7:2> not used by DFM.
03198                                                          WODT_D0_R1<1:0> is also not used by DFM when RANK_ENA is not set. */
03199     uint64_t wodt_d0_r0                   : 8;  /**< Write ODT mask RANK0
03200                                                          WODT_D0_R0<7:2> not used by DFM. */
03201 #else
03202     uint64_t wodt_d0_r0                   : 8;
03203     uint64_t wodt_d0_r1                   : 8;
03204     uint64_t wodt_d1_r0                   : 8;
03205     uint64_t wodt_d1_r1                   : 8;
03206     uint64_t wodt_d2_r0                   : 8;
03207     uint64_t wodt_d2_r1                   : 8;
03208     uint64_t wodt_d3_r0                   : 8;
03209     uint64_t wodt_d3_r1                   : 8;
03210 #endif
03211     } s;
03212     struct cvmx_dfm_wodt_mask_s           cn63xx;
03213     struct cvmx_dfm_wodt_mask_s           cn63xxp1;
03214     struct cvmx_dfm_wodt_mask_s           cn66xx;
03215 };
03216 typedef union cvmx_dfm_wodt_mask cvmx_dfm_wodt_mask_t;
03217 
03218 #endif
